page.title: 10GOLF CLUB, BRACKNELL.
page.content: On the{Golf Course}the ground cover is mainly fern and heather with rhodedendrons in abundance. This is the environment which provided the home, sixty years ago, for the prestigious{Berkshire Golf Club.} The Club is the proud owner of two courses, North and South, Red and Blue, a large club house with its own restaurant, and a shop, which sells all manner of general golfing parafernalia. There are a few houses and bungalows for the staff. The sandy nature of the soil necessitates a sophisticated {irrigation scheme}to the greens. This work is currently being carried out and will enable irrigation to be controlled by a pump at each green. The club owns four-wheeled "search cars" for the elderly or infirm,or the merely idle!
